channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: From Elon Musk to Tucker Carlson: International support pours in for arrested Telegram founder Pavel Durov
item.description: French-Russian tech tycoon Pavel Durov was detained at a Paris airport over alleged offences linked to his messaging app Telegram, including fraud and drug trafficking. His arrest, pending a court appearance, has stirred discussions about Telegram's content moderation policies, with notable figures expressing concerns over free speech and censorship implications.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Palestinian prisoner, who was used as human shield by Israeli military, dies
item.description: Zaher Raddad, a 19-year-old Palestinian prisoner, died at an Israeli hospital. He was previously used as a human shield by the Israeli military during a military operation. Arrested on July 23, Raddad hailed from Saida in Tulkarm. Since the October 7 Hamas attack, 23 prisoners have died in Israeli custody. Truce talks are ongoing in Doha.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Musk in the White House? Trump floats Elon as US government 'fat cutter' extraordinaire; Watch video
item.description: Former President Donald Trump expressed interest in having Elon Musk help streamline government operations if he wins the upcoming election. Trump praised Musk's brilliance and suggested he could serve as a high-level consultant focusing on artificial intelligence. This development follows Musk's recent endorsement of Trump and their evolving political alliance.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US elections: Was DNC a superspreader event of Covid? Netizens react as multiple attendees test positive
item.description: Following the Democratic National Convention in Chicago, numerous attendees, including reporters and audience members, tested positive for Covid-19. The four-day event saw significant participation, including Vice President Kamala Harris. Several attendees shared their positive results on social media, describing their disappointment. This gathering marked the first major in-person Democratic event since 2016.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: China's military says it conducted armed patrols, joint police patrols near China-Myanmar border
item.description: China's military organized units and joint air-ground police patrols near the Myanmar border to maintain security as clashes between Myanmar's junta and rebel forces worsened. The operations focused on areas like Ruili and Zhenkang. China's increased military presence aimed to stabilize the region after artillery shells from Myanmar caused damage and injuries on Chinese territory.

item.title: Warren to Vance: ‘Women are not stupid’ as GOP VP pick says Trump ‘would veto’ abortion ban
item.description: Senator Elizabeth Warren criticized Senator JD Vance’s claim that Donald Trump would veto a federal abortion ban if re-elected. Warren argued that even without a ban, Trump's administration would still impose restrictions. She referenced the historic Comstock Act and urged voters to support pro-abortion rights candidates to ensure the restoration of nationwide access to abortion.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Democracy on line? Swing state Wisconsin offers a test
item.description: Michael Hovde, a Wisconsin voter, viewed Trump as a threat to democracy, highlighting concerns about Trump's associates and Project 2025. Meanwhile, Casey Stern supported Trump, focusing on inflation, immigration, and crime. Wisconsin, a pivotal state, has experienced intense partisanship, with the recent Supreme Court ruling on redistricting potentially impacting the upcoming election.

item.title: US elections: Taylor Swift set to endorse Kamala Harris? ‘Excited about possibility of a woman in the White House’
item.description: Taylor Swift was expected to endorse Kamala Harris's presidential bid, offering significant support to Harris’s campaign. Swift's influence and fan base, along with her history of mobilizing youth voters, could play a crucial role in the election. Both Biden and Harris sought her endorsement, while Trump’s camp showed uncertainty about Swift’s political alignment.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: In likely overture to China, Nepal PM Oli lifts ban on TikTok
Edu ministry adviser calls for stop to forced resignations
'For 20 years, they let this guy go by with a lie': Critics accuse Walz of military 'misrepresentation'
item.description: Minnesota Governor Tim Walz faced controversy over past claims about his career achievements and military rank. A 2006 letter from the Nebraska Chamber of Commerce refuted his claim of receiving an award. Additionally, Walz's military rank has been questioned, as he retired as a Master Sergeant, not a Command Sergeant Major, as previously stated.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Run, Kamala, Run': Mention of Harris' father was a rare homage to a fleeting figure
item.description: Kamala Harris attributed her father's words of encouragement from her childhood as an inspiration during her acceptance speech at the Democratic National Convention. She emphasized her mother's significant influence on her life. Her father, Donald J. Harris, a prominent economist, turned 86 the day after her speech but was not among the attending family members.

item.title: Trump ex-adviser says Putin played on his ego
Students, para force personnel clash near Secretariat in Dhaka
Have patience, efforts on to overcome challenges: Yunus
item.description: Muhammad Yunus, Bangladesh's interim chief adviser, requested citizens to be patient with the government's efforts to address significant challenges. Speaking in a televised address, Yunus emphasized the importance of political decisions and cooperation for reforms. He urged people to avoid taking the law into their hands and revealed plans to establish a memorial foundation.

item.title: Ties with Dhaka stay unchanged: China to Yunus
Trump warns US is on brink of World War III: 'Bombs are dropping, and Kamala’s campaigning!'
item.description: Donald Trump warned that the US is nearing World War III under Vice President Kamala Harris, after Israel conducted airstrikes against Hezbollah targets, leading to heightened regional tensions. Trump's statements criticized the Biden administration's handling of the Middle East situation. The Israeli military defended their actions as preventive, while Hezbollah retaliated with rocket attacks.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Hurricane Hone lashes Hawaii's Big Island with furious waves and flooding, thousands lose power
item.description: Hurricane Hone passed close to Hawaii's Big Island, bringing heavy rain and causing power outages for around 15,000 residents. Despite nearly 18 inches of rainfall, no major damage or injuries were reported. Forecasters predicted up to 20 inches of rain in some areas, raising concerns about flash flooding. The community remained ready to support each other during the storm.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: What is Hezbollah in Lebanon: Catalyst for Middle East war or path to peace?
item.description: Israel and Hezbollah engaged in a tense exchange following Israel's assassination of Hezbollah commander Fuad Shukur. Preemptive strikes, rocket launches, and subsequent retaliations marked the conflict. Both sides claimed victories and emphasized avoidance of further escalation. Despite temporary de-escalation, the conflict remains unresolved, risking potential regional implications.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: What if China invades? For Taiwan, a TV show raises tough questions
item.description: A new Taiwanese TV series, "Zero Day," depicted a chaotic scenario of a Chinese invasion of Taiwan, sparking controversy. Some praised it for raising awareness, while critics called it scaremongering. The drama explores China's possible takeover through a blockade and invasion, causing societal turmoil. Despite concerns, the show received governmental support and faced some production challenges.
